intro: Dichapetalum varians, commonly known as the variable dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage consists of large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture.
